title: Understanding human-robot teams in light of all-human teams: Aspects of team interaction and shared cognition
author: @b[{Mustafa Demir@c},{ Nathan J McNeese@c},{ Nancy J Cooke@c}]@b
abstract: BACKGROUND: As robots become more autonomous, their roles shift from being operated and controlled by humans to interactively teaming with humans. The current research focuses on how human operators can effectively team with autonomous urban search and rescue agents in a dynamic and complex task environment. To do so, we empirically examined how shared cognition and restricted language capabilities impacted performance of human-robot dyad search teams using a simulated Minecraft task environment.
